title: BC-US--Money & Markets Extra Digest, US
text: For the week ending Saturday, July 18, 2015 MONEY MATTERS-FED RATE HIKE The Federal Reserve has indicated that in the coming months it will begin raising interest rates for the first time in six years. That could spell bad news for borrowers carrying high-interest credit card debt or other loans. Here are some options to consider before rates begin climbing. THE WEEK IN REVIEW Police departments establish "safe zones" for online transactions; Study: Uber tops taxi use for business travel; FAO Schwarz closes flagship store. QUICK FIX Getting started: The 411 on 529s College savings plans, known as 529s, are an easy way to set aside money for college but they can be confusing. We break down the basics to help understand this investment tool. WIRELESS & CASHLESS Shopping without credit card Want to buy stuff on your smartphone without using a credit card? Some online retailers are partnering with lenders who pay for your purchase up front, while sending you a bill later. SMALL BUSINESS MONITOR Be smart about charity Small businesses often support charitable organizations, but business owners should heed caution before they write a check or donate property. CENTERPIECE Dorm dollars College students and their families are planning to spend a bit less this year on back-to-school needs -- and wants. Although they're expected to cut back on electronics this year, the latest survey from the National Retail Federation shows that they plan to boost spending on furnishings to make their dorm rooms more like home. MARKET PULSE Technology continues to be the sector that's most dependent on foreign sales; workers have more of their IRAs in stocks than in any year since the Great Recession; S&P downgraded the most credit ratings for corporate issuers last quarter since 2009. OF MUTUAL INTEREST-CHINA FUNDS
